summary: This document is an email from whistleblower Chris DiIorio to an SEC official (Ms. Pasquinelli) appealing the denial of a whistleblower award. It alleges widespread SEC corruption and obstruction, specifically that the SEC failed to post eligible enforcement actions based on his information, protected criminal enterprises like Knight Capital/KCG/Virtu (NITE), and facilitated ongoing securities fraud and money laundering schemes involving numerous individuals and shell companies.

persons.name: Chris DiIorio
persons.context: Author of the email, submitting a formal appeal for a denied whistleblower award and alleging extensive SEC corruption and ongoing securities fraud.

persons.name: Ms. Pasquinelli
persons.context: Recipient of the email, presumably an SEC staffer handling whistleblower award appeals.

persons.name: Joshua Sason
persons.context: Named in an SEC microcap stock fraud litigation (Release No. LR-24403). Allegedly involved in money laundering shells like NewLead.

persons.name: John M. Fife
persons.context: Charged by the SEC for acting as an unregistered securities dealer through companies like Chicago Venture Partners and Iliad Research and Trading.

persons.name: Justin W. Keener
persons.context: Charged by the SEC as an unregistered penny stock dealer doing business as JMJ Financial.

persons.name: Cifu
persons.context: CEO of Virtu Financial (VIRT), which acquired KCG/Knight. Accused of concealing financials and facilitating fraud.

persons.name: Barry Honig
persons.context: Referred to as a 'prolific Bag Man' involved in multiple alleged money laundering shells like MGT Capital, Riot Blockchain (fka Aspenbio/Venaxis/Bioptix), and Inergetics.

persons.name: Stetson
persons.context: Sidekick of Barry Honig, involved in shells like Therapix (now SciSparc) and Bioptix.

persons.name: Frost
persons.context: Multi-billionaire investor associated with Alpha Capital Anstalt, involved in money laundering schemes per the author.

persons.name: Robert Eide
persons.context: CEO of Aegis Capital Corp, a broker-dealer implicated in SEC/FINRA actions and alleged money laundering.

persons.name: Kevin McKenna
persons.context: Named alongside Robert Eide in an SEC action related to Aegis Capital's violations.

persons.name: Mr. Gottschall
persons.context: SEC investigator criticized for a supposedly inadequate investigation into Riot Blockchain.

persons.name: Brian Colleran
persons.context: Healthcare fraud felon who became a large shareholder in Millennium Biotech (later Inergetics), which was controlled by Barry Honig.

persons.name: Chad Readler
persons.context: Former DOJ prosecutor on the Colleran healthcare fraud case, later appointed as a federal judge by Trump.

persons.name: Mark B. Fisher
persons.context: Owner of MBF Clearing Corp and MBF Capital, involved in a fraud 'acquisition' related to Riot Blockchain.

persons.name: Eric Bustilloe
persons.context: Director of the SEC's Miami office, described as 'grossly corrupt'.

persons.name: Dmitry Akhanov
persons.context: CEO of Rusnano USA Inc., head of the Russian Federal Energy Agency, and an insider in Bioptix (precursor to Riot Blockchain).

persons.name: Scott Shay
persons.context: Chairman of Signature Bank (SBNY), which served as escrow agent for Bioptix offerings and has ties to Trump/Kushner.

persons.name: Dan Kamensky
persons.context: Individual sentenced by Judge Cote in a case the author claims was a miscarriage of justice related to Handler/Jefferies and Ares Management.

persons.name: Jason Sunstein
persons.context: San Diego resident and CFO of several OTC-market shell companies like Viper Networks and Santeon Group.

persons.name: Ashraf Rofail
persons.context: CEO of Santeon Group, another alleged shell company.

persons.name: Judge Cote
persons.context: SDNY judge who sentenced Dan Kamensky; the author calls the sentencing a 'gross miscarriage of justice'.

persons.name: Judge Engelmayer
persons.context: SDNY judge addressed by the author regarding the Riot Blockchain fraud.

persons.name: Judge Ramos
persons.context: SDNY judge addressed by the author regarding SEC corruption.

persons.name: SEC IG Hoecker
persons.context: SEC Inspector General questioned by the author about plausible denials and accused of criminal obstruction.

persons.name: Ms. Hodgman Strzok
persons.context: Referred to as an 'expert at criminal obstruction' in the context of the Archegos/Hwang investigation.

connections.description: Whistleblower submitting an appeal and allegations of corruption to an SEC official.
Described as sidekicks involved together in multiple alleged money laundering shell companies like Therapix/SciSparc and Bioptix/RIOT.
Both involved in alleged money laundering schemes; Sason's entities held shares in Inergetics, a shell controlled by Honig.
Colleran became a large shareholder in Millennium Biotech/Inergetics, a shell controlled by Honig.
Both named in SEC action against Aegis Capital Corp for violations.
Fife/Iliad was involved in MGT Capital, a Honig shell, just before its registration was revoked.
Akhanov was an insider in Bioptix, a Honig/Stetson shell that became Riot Blockchain.
Cifu is the CEO of Virtu Financial, which acquired KCG/Knight Capital (NITE).
Fisher's entities are based in NY but have a Miami connection; Bustilloe is the SEC Miami Director, implied to be corruptly connected.
Author claims Kamensky was set up by Handler/Ressler of Ares Management because his bid threatened their Neiman Marcus deal.

events.title: SEC Charges Joshua Sason et al.
events.description: SEC files charges in an elaborate microcap stock fraud litigation (Release No. LR-24403).

events.title: SEC Charges John M. Fife et al.
events.description: SEC charges John M. Fife and companies he controls for acting as an unregistered securities dealer.

events.title: SEC Charges Justin W. Keener
events.description: SEC charges Justin W. Keener d/b/a JMJ Financial as an unregistered penny stock dealer.

events.title: Virtu Financial Q1 2021 Earnings Call
events.description: Virtu Financial (VIRT) Q1 2021 earnings call where CEO Cifu disclosed April volumes but allegedly concealed KCG financials.

events.title: SEC Ends Riot Blockchain Investigation
events.description: SEC Denver office ends investigation into Riot Blockchain without recommending enforcement action.

events.title: FINRA Settlement with Aegis Capital
events.description: FINRA Office of Hearing Officers accepts Offer of Settlement from Aegis Capital Corp. (Disciplinary Proceeding No. 2011026386002).

locations: Castle Rock, CO (alleged HQ of Riot Blockchain)
40 Wall Street, New York (listed office for Sason entities)
Miami, FL (implied connection to Mark B. Fisher and SEC Director Bustilloe)
San Diego, CA (base for Jason Sunstein's shell companies and SEC LA office)
keyFacts: The whistleblower, Chris DiIorio, claims the SEC has criminally obstructed justice by failing to post three eligible enforcement actions (involving Sason, Fife, and Keener) based on his information to the whistleblower award website.
DiIorio alleges that Knight Capital/KCG/Virtu (NITE) is a criminal enterprise that remains insolvent due to illegal naked shorting and money laundering, actively protected by the SEC.
The document claims Riot Blockchain (fka Aspenbio/Venaxis/Bioptix) is a non-operational 'money laundering shell' controlled by Barry Honig and associates, kept alive through SEC corruption.
Russian government-linked individual Dmitry Akhanov (Rusnano USA) is identified as an insider in Bioptix, the precursor to Riot Blockchain, raising national security concerns.

The author asserts a pattern of interconnected fraud involving numerous individuals (Honig, Sason, Frost, etc.), shell companies, and compromised SEC officials across multiple offices (NY, Denver, Miami, LA).
